<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 178, 292]]<|/det|>
## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 276, 905, 291]]<|/det|>
9702/23  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 390, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 AS Level Structured Questions  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 300, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
October/November 2024  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[752, 325, 905, 340]]<|/det|>
1 hour 15 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 359, 400]]<|/det|>
No additional materials are needed.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 433]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 808, 558]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- You should show all your working and use appropriate units.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 588, 213, 602]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 604, 728, 635]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 60.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 73, 128, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>Data</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 103, 594, 120]]<|/det|>
acceleration of free fall \(g = 9.81 \text{ m s}^{-2}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 135, 640, 152]]<|/det|>
speed of light in free space \(c = 3.00 \times 10^{8} \text{ m s}^{-1}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 167, 630, 184]]<|/det|>
elementary charge \(e = 1.60 \times 10^{-19} \text{ C}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 199, 630, 216]]<|/det|>
unified atomic mass unit \(1 \text{ u} = 1.66 \times 10^{-27} \text{ kg}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 231, 630, 248]]<|/det|>
rest mass of proton \(m_{\mathrm{p}} = 1.67 \times 10^{-27} \text{ kg}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 262, 630, 279]]<|/det|>
rest mass of electron \(m_{\mathrm{e}} = 9.11 \times 10^{-31} \text{ kg}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 293, 650, 310]]<|/det|>
Avogadro constant \(N_{\mathrm{A}} = 6.02 \times 10^{23} \text{ mol}^{-1}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 324, 630, 341]]<|/det|>
molar gas constant \(R = 8.31 \text{ J K}^{-1} \text{ mol}^{-1}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 355, 650, 372]]<|/det|>
Boltzmann constant \(k = 1.38 \times 10^{-23} \text{ J K}^{-1}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 386, 690, 403]]<|/det|>
gravitational constant \(G = 6.67 \times 10^{-11} \text{ N m}^{2} \text{ kg}^{-2}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 417, 650, 434]]<|/det|>
permittivity of free space \(\varepsilon_{0} = 8.85 \times 10^{-12} \text{ F m}^{-1}\)

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[405, 434, 650, 465]]<|/det|>
\[(\frac{1}{4\pi\epsilon_{0}} = 8.99\times 10^{9}\mathrm{mF}^{-1})\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 479, 636, 496]]<|/det|>
Planck constant \(h = 6.63 \times 10^{-34} \text{ J s}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 510, 688, 527]]<|/det|>
Stefan–Boltzmann constant \(\sigma = 5.67 \times 10^{-8} \text{ W m}^{-2} \text{ K}^{-4}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 567, 170, 583]]<|/det|>
<form>Formulae</form>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 600, 584, 616]]<|/det|>
uniformly accelerated motion \(s = ut + \frac{1}{2} at^{2}\)

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[437, 616, 584, 636]]<|/det|>
\[\nu^{2} = u^{2} + 2as\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 650, 551, 667]]<|/det|>
hydrostatic pressure \(\Delta p = \rho g \Delta h\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 682, 544, 698]]<|/det|>
upthrust \(F = \rho g V\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 720, 560, 747]]<|/det|>
Doppler effect for sound waves \(f_{0} = \frac{f_{s} \nu}{\nu \pm \nu_{s}}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 763, 560, 780]]<|/det|>
electric current \(I = A n v q\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 795, 616, 812]]<|/det|>
resistors in series \(R = R_{1} + R_{2} + \ldots\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[81, 826, 616, 853]]<|/det|>
resistors in parallel \(\frac{1}{R} = \frac{1}{R_{1}} + \frac{1}{R_{2}} + \ldots\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 163, 918, 199]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 460, 918, 496]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 492, 808, 512]]<|/det|>
A load of weight \(2.6 \text{N}\) is suspended from the beam at distance \(x\) from the pivot.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 523, 920, 574]]<|/det|>
A wooden cylinder of weight \(4.0 \text{N}\) is suspended from the beam at a distance of \(0.40 \text{m}\) from the pivot on the opposite side of the pivot to the load. The cylinder rests in a container of water. The lower part of the cylinder is immersed in the water to depth \(h\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 586, 826, 604]]<|/det|>
Initially, \(h\) is equal to \(0.10 \text{m}\) and \(x\) is equal to \(0.40 \text{m}\). The system is in equilibrium.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 618, 181, 636]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 618, 920, 650]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 102, 720, 121]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 286, 920, 336]]<|/det|>
Two wires X and Y, with equal unstretched lengths of \(0.84 \text{m}\), are suspended from fixed points that are at the same horizontal level. The lower ends of the wires are attached to a beam of negligible mass. The beam is horizontal and in equilibrium, as shown in Fig. 4.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[250, 355, 744, 567]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 581, 532, 600]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 612, 742, 631]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 628, 470, 645]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 658, 920, 691]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 71, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
A source of sound waves of frequency \(780\mathrm{Hz}\) is on a rotating platform. The speed of the source is \(39\mathrm{m s}^{- 1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 117, 920, 153]]<|/det|>
The sound is detected by an observer that is a large distance from the rotating platform, as shown in Fig. 5.2.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 160, 845, 306]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 319, 591, 338]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 351, 180, 369]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 350, 510, 369]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[396, 536, 920, 555]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 160, 141, 179]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 160, 920, 198]]<|/det|>
A cylindrical metal wire of length \(2.4 \text{m}\) and cross-sectional area \(8.0 \times 10^{-6} \text{m}^2\) has a resistance of \(0.33 \Omega\). There is a current in the wire of \(4.7 \text{A}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 210, 180, 229]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 210, 737, 229]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[487, 364, 920, 383]]<|/det|>
<form>resistivity = .................................................... \(\Omega\) m [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 395, 181, 414]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 395, 808, 414]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[505, 551, 920, 570]]<|/det|>
<form>charge = .................................................... C [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 583, 180, 602]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 583, 920, 616]]<|/det|>
The free electrons (charge carriers) in the wire have an average drift speed of \(0.16 \text{mm} \text{s}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 628, 702, 647]]<|/det|>
Determine the number density of charge carriers in the metal.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[437, 782, 920, 801]]<|/det|>
<form>number density = ................................................ m⁻³ [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
The wire in (b) may be considered to be a fixed resistor. It is connected in series with a thermistor to a battery that has negligible internal resistance.
